title: It's time to have your vision restored.
description: Restore Your Vision with our Netra Restoration Therapy (NRT) Integrative eye treatments with Ayurveda and Acupuncture.
cleaned_text: Are you experiencing vision loss or reduced vision from Glaucoma, Macular Degeneration, Diabetic Retinopathy, Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), Keratoconus, Myopia, Dry Eyes or Retinal Occlusion ? Our breakthrough and revolutionized Netra Restoration Therapy (NRT) will help restore your vision. Find out if you are a candidate for NRT. 6, 12 and 24 Month Payment Plans are available. Mr. Philip Mr. Nikil Natural treatments like acupuncture, herbals medicine and ayurvedic therapies help restore your defective vision and improve your visual acuity. Treatments help achieve improved visual acuity, ability to see more vibrant colors, improved perception to light and reduced photophobia. Most patients will have improvement in their overall health condition as most of our treatments also treats other internal disorders in addition to treating the eye disorder. Our results speaks for themselves. We offer a holistic treatment approach to your eye condition integrating Acupuncture, Ayurveda and Herbal Medicines. Acupuncture and Herbal Medicine Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) is a complete medical system that has been used to treat and prevent illnesses for more than 2,000 years. Using Acupuncture and Herbal Medicine as its primary treatment methods can treat and prevent a wide range of eye disorders. Ayurvedic Therapies and Herbal Medicine Ayurveda originated in India more than 5,000 years ago and is often regarded as the "Mother of All Healing". Shalakya Tantra is a branch of Ayurvedic Medicine which deals and treats with numerous eye disorders. Ayurvedic Therapies include Panchakarma and Herbal Medicine are used to treat and prevent a wide range of eye disorders. Yoga therapeutically tailored to address your condition. A 3,000 year old tradition, Yoga, is now regarded as a holistic approach to health and is classified by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) as a form of Complementary and Alternative Medicine. Therapeutic Yoga is defined as the application of yoga postures and practice to the treatment of health conditions.
